strings.Value: "You monsters threaten humanity. You may seem civilized, but there's a dark beast deep inside each of you, a beast that must be stopped before it bites."
[Shrug] "It just happened this way."
"I just enjoy killing. Listening to trolls scream when acid touches their skin... and slaughtering kobolds by the score, well, who hasn't time for that?"
"My barony is for civilized races only. Your kind are murderers and are not welcome here."
"You attacked my barony. I protect my subjects."
"I see you haven't taught your pet to heel, Tartuk. Serves you right — these trolls may be strong, but the village dog has more obedience and sense than they do."

"You beg to be put on a leash, Hargulka! I'd make you my jester, and when you'd bore me enough, I'd set my hounds against you — just like Tartuk is setting us on you now — and I'd let your screams entertain me."
"Just listen to that kobold! 'Ally'! When did kobolds become your equals? No troll would be a kobold's dog, Hargulka — even I know that!"

"Yes, yes, Hargulka, don't listen to borba! Listen to Tartuk, sacrifice yourself and pave the kobold's road to glory with troll corpses! I bet you never thought of yourself, even when Tartuk sent your tribe to their deaths! I wonder, is it because you were born a fool — or a slave?"
"I have to ask, how long are you going to pretend, Tartuccio? I know who you are."
{n}The troll's eyes become bloodshot.{/n} "What?" {n}He slowly turns toward Tartuk, who takes a cautious step aside.{/n}
"Don't lisssten to {mf|him|her}, fearlesss and wissse Hargulka! {mf|He'sss|Ssshe'sss} trying to trick you! Anger you! I wasss alwaysss your ally!"

"Liesss, liesss!" {n}Tartuk glares at the approaching troll.{/n} Humansss are trying to ssset usss againssst each other! Can't you sssee it? Sssss! Ssstupid troll! Ssstupid-" {n}The kobold's rant suddenly falters and his eyes go wide.{/n}

{n}Hargulka glares at you, his eyes bulging with anger. A moment later, a deep growl rises from his chest and seems to shake the walls around you.{/n} "Tartuk..." {n}The enormous troll turns and takes a step toward the kobold.{/n}
{n}Hearing the word 'Tartuccio', the kobold waves his hand hesitantly. But then freezes and hisses angrily:{/n} "You know nosssing, nosssing! So? Will you tell usss, why you brought usss death?"
{n}Tartuk puts aside the iron rod he just used to finish branding the troll.{/n} "Ssstop, courageousss and ssstrong Hargulka. I wisssh to asssk."
{n}Hargulka takes a deep breath, his chest rattling, then spits on the floor.{/n} "Borba kills because trolls and kobolds are unlike {mf|him|her}. That's what all borba do."
"Trollsss and koboldsss can not essstablisssh kingdom while humansss kill them."
"Deathhh!" {n}Fire burns in the kobold's eyes, bright within his horse-skull helmet.{/n}
"Sssay me, {race}. Why are you ssslaying usss? What did we to you? Why take troll and kobold livesss in their own home?"
"Death! Dur borba!" {n}Hargulka pounds his club on the stone floor.{/n}
{n}A deafening roar erupts from Hargulka's chest.{/n} "STUPID TROLL?! I'LL KILL YOU!"
"Borba! You managed to get here." {n}Hargulka turns from the anvil — and on his chest is a brightly glowing brand mark.{/n} "Good. Now Hargulka will tear you apart with his own hands."
